intro: Hedyotis grantii, commonly known as the Grant's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Hedyotis grantii is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
